input_str:
Author: Marshall Schott

Maybe 6 or 7 years ago, I went for a breakfast visit with my beautiful and ailing Grandma Jan. She’d waited for me to arrive before starting the coffee, as she wanted the Folgers to be fresh for her grandson, a typical gesture of thoughtfulness from this sweet soul. She added the appropriate amount of water to the reservoir and scooped the coffee into the paper cone, then she did something I wasn’t expecting and sprinkled table salt onto the grounds.
